trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The genie has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The genie makes four attacks, each of which can be a Refraction Beam or a Telekinetic Punch attack.
The genie can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.

action.name: Refraction Beam
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 13} to hit, range 30 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d10 + 7}) radiant damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or their vision becomes blurry and they have disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks that rely on sight until the start of the genie's next turn.

action.name: Telekinetic Punch
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d8 + 7}) force damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 21} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Blinding Light
entries: A burst of light emanates from the genie's crown. Each creature within 30 feet of the genie that can see them must succeed on a {@dc 21} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition blinded} until the start of the creature's next turn.

reaction.name: Gem Reflection (3/Day)
entries: If the genie makes a successful saving throw against a spell or a spell attack misses it, the genie can choose another creature (including the spellcaster) it can see within 30 feet of it. The spell targets the chosen creature instead of the genie. If the spell forced a saving throw, the chosen creature makes their own save. If the spell was an attack, the attack roll is rerolled against the chosen creature.

reaction.name: Lair Actions
entries: Lair Actions When fighting inside their lair, the genie can use lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the genie can take one of the following lair actions; the genie can't take the same lair action two rounds in a row:

items: The ground within 30 feet of the genie becomes difficult terrain for creatures the genie chooses until initiative count 20 on the next round. In addition, each creature chosen that is standing on the ground in the area must succeed on a {@dc 21} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.
The genie conjures a 30-foot-radius sphere of magical darkness centered on a point they choose within 120 feet of them, which lasts until initiative count 20 on the next round..

A floating gem appears in an unoccupied space within 120 feet of the genie and disappears on initiative count 20 of the following round. Each creature within 10 feet of the gem that can see it when it appears must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw, or become {@condition charmed} by the genie until the gem disappears. While {@condition charmed} in this way, a creature is {@condition incapacitated} and has a speed

reaction.name: of 0
entries: The effect ends if the creature takes damage or if someone takes an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

reaction.name: Regional Effects
entries: The territory within 5 miles of a crowned genie is altered by the creature's psionic and crystalline presence, creating one or more of the following effects:

items: Mines abound with gems and crystals.
Xorn are common in the region and seek gems in the mines.
Once per day, each creature allied with the genie can roll a {@dice d4} and add the number to an Intelligence check.

entries: If the genie dies, these effects immediately end.

monster.name: Amethyst Servant Assassin
languages: thieves' cant plus any two languages

trait.name: Assassinate
entries: During their first turn, the assassin has advantage on attack rolls against any creature that hasn't taken a turn. Any hit the assassin scores against a surprised creature is a critical hit.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the assassin is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the assassin instead takes no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

trait.name: Sneak Attack
entries: Once per turn, the assassin deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when they hit a target with a weapon attack and have advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the assassin that isn't {@condition incapacitated} and the assassin doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The assassin makes two Shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw, taking 24 ({@damage 7d6}) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The mage is a 9th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 14}, {@hit 6} to hit with spell attacks). The mage has the following wizard spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two Longsword attacks.
If they have a shortsword drawn, they can also make a Shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The phlegmming has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the phlegmming's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Slippery
entries: The phlegmming can occupy another creature's space and vice versa.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The phlegmming can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack (Large or Bigger Size Only)
entries: The phlegmming makes two Pseudopod attacks.

action.name: Pseudopod
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. The damage increases based on the phlegmming's size.

reaction.name: Converge
entries: When the phlegmming sees a friendly phlegmming within 5 feet of them take damage that doesn't reduce that phlegmming to 0 hit points, they can leap to the injured phlegmming's aid and merge their body with the injured phlegmming, becoming one creature.

The merged phlegmming's hit point maximum equals the combined total hit point maximum of both phlegmmings that merged, and their current hit points are equal to the combined current hit points of both phlegmmings that merged. The phlegmming's other statistics change based on their new hit point maximum as shown on the Phlegmming Growth table.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The hag casts the following spells, requiring no material components and using Constitution as their spellcasting ability ({@dc 14}):

trait.name: Algoomist
entries: Oozes regard the hag as a friendly creature.
An Ooze can't be convinced that the hag is their enemy, even if an Ooze is {@condition charmed} by the hag's enemy.

trait.name: Repulsive Flesh
entries: When the hag is hit with a ranged weapon attack and isn't {@condition incapacitated}, they can make a Constitution saving throw with a DC equal to the result of the attack roll (no action required). On a success, the hag takes no damage and redirects the attack at a creature of their choice that they can see within 60 feet of them. The redirected attack uses the original attack roll.

trait.name: Shifting Visage
entries: When a creature starts their turn within 10 feet of the hag, the creature must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} of the hag until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hag makes two Claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Change Shape (1/Day)
entries: The hag magically polymorphs into a black pudding, and can remain in this form for up to 6 hours. The hag's equipment melds with their new form.

While in this new form, the hag retains their game statistics and ability to speak, but their AC, movement modes, Strength, and Dexterity are replaced by those of the black pudding, they lose the Repulsive Flesh trait, and they gain the special senses, proficiencies, traits, actions, and reactions of the black pudding.

The hag reverts to their true form if they die or if they use a bonus action to end the transformation early. If the hag reverts to their true form after using Split as a black pudding, the hag chooses which black pudding reverts to their true form.
Any additional black puddings remain active and autonomous from the hag.

bonus.name: Apply Creams
entries: The hag touches an Ooze within 5 feet of them and absorbs some of the Ooze into their body. The Ooze takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage and the hag gains temporary hit points equal to the damage dealt. While the hag has temporary hit points from this feature, they deal an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) acid damage with their claws.

trait.name: Coated in Ichor
entries: When the Regigoo makes a Blood Bite attack or uses Erupt Viscera or their Diastole legendary action, other creatures can gain ichor points, representing how coated they are in the Regigoo's ichor. For every ichor point a creature has, their speed is reduced by 5 feet, and their Dexterity modifier is reduced by 1. A creature with 1 or 2 ichor points or a creature that can reach them can use an action to wipe the ichor from their body, reducing the creature's ichor points to 0.

If a creature has 3 or more ichor points, they are {@condition restrained}. While {@condition restrained} in this way, the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage at the end of each of their turns. Another creature that can reach a creature with 3 or more ichor points can use an action to try to remove the ichor by making a {@dc 16} Strength (Ath- letics) check. On a successful check, the creature's ichor points are reduced to 0.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The Regigoo is immune to any spell or effect that would alter their form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Regigoo fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Transfer Pain
entries: Each time the Regigoo takes damage, they can redirect damage to any number of creatures with 3 or more ichor points (no action required). Each affected creature loses 9 ({@dice 2d8}) hit points. The damage the Regigoo takes is reduced by an amount equal to the total number of hit points lost by these creatures.

action.name: Blood Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) necrotic damage and the target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, gaining 1 ichor point on a failed save.

action.name: Viscera Eruption
entries: The Regigoo writhes and thrashes, splattering viscera nearby. Each creature within 30 feet of the Regigoo must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage and gaining 1 ichor point on a failed save, or half as much damage without gaining any ichor points on a successful one.

legendary.name: Blood Bite
entries: The Regigoo makes a Blood Bite attack.

legendary.name: Diastole
entries: The Regigoo pulses like an echoing heartbeat, expanding outward. Each creature within 60 feet of the Regigoo that isn't a Construct or Undead must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is pulled up to 30 feet toward the Regigoo and falls {@condition prone}. A creature that is pulled within 5 feet of Regigoogains 1 ichor point.

legendary.name: Systole
entries: The Regigoo pulses like an echoing heartbeat, contracting inward. Each creature with at least 1 ichor point takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) necrotic damage.

legendary.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Regigoo can take a lair action to cause one of the following magical effects. It can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.
• The Regigoo can puppeteer up to 3 creatures with 1 or more ichor point, forcing each one to move up to 30 feet in any direction the Regigoo chooses.
• The Regigoo seeps into the ground and reemerges up to 60 feet away in an unoccupied space. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

• The Regigoo selects a creature within 120 feet of it with at least 2 ichor points. That creature's ichor score is reduced to 0, and the ichor slides off their body and becomes a black pudding that forms in a space within 5 feet of the creature. The pudding acts on initiative count 20 each round after the Regigoo uses their lair action.

trait.name: Guiding Beacon
entries: A lit torch held by the torchbearer provides bright light in a 25-foot radius and dim light for an additional 25 feet.

trait.name: Lucky Break
entries: When the torchbearer takes damage from a trap, roll a {@dice d6}. On a 6, the trap breaks down or misses at the last second and the torchbearer miraculously takes no damage.

trait.name: Sitting Duck
entries: If an allied creature within 5 feet of the torchbearer is hit by an attack, the creature can use their reaction to cause the attack to hit the torchbearer instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The torchbearer makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Burning Torch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this attack ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

trait.name: Arcane Artifice
entries: Each student has one of the following magical advantages (choose one or roll a {@dice d4}):

items.name: 1. Training Wand (3/Day)
entries: When the student sees a creature within 30 feet of them casting a spell of 3rd level or lower with a casting time of 1 action, the student can use their reaction to store the same spell in their wand. As an action on their next turn, the student can cast the spell from their wand, requiring no components. If the spell is not cast, it disappears from the wand at the end of the student's turn.

items.name: 2. Dust of Glimmering (1/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, the student can blow a handful of dust in a 15-foot cone.

Each creature in this area must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or shed dim light in a 10-foot radius for 1 minute. Any attack roll against an affected creature has advantage if the attacker can see them, and the affected creature can't benefit from being {@condition invisible}.

items.name: 3. Familiar
entries: The student can cast the {@spell find familiar} spell at will and is accompanied by a familiar.

items.name: 4. Cloak of Fading (1/Day)
entries: When the student takes damage, they can use their reaction to teleport, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, up to 60 feet to an unoccupied space that they can see, leaving behind an empty, nonmagical cloak in the space they left.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Magic Missile (3/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: The student creates three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature the student can see within 120 feet. A dart deals 3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) force damage to its target. The darts all strike simultaneously, and the student can direct them to hit one creature or several.

action.name: Thunderwave (1/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from the student must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from the student. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from the student, and the thunderwave emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

reaction.name: Shield (1/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: When the student is hit by an attack or targeted by the {@spell magic missile} spell, an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force appears and protects them.
Until the start of their next turn, the student has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and takes no damage from magic missile.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Explosive Vial
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) fire damage.

action.name: Onyx Ooze Vial (3/Day)
entries: The alchemist hurls a glass vial containing a captive onyx ooze at an unoccupied space they can see within 20 feet of them. The ooze expands on contact with air, becoming a Medium-sized creature. The ooze acts immediately after the alchemist in the initiative count. The ooze attacks the creature closest to it and is not under the alchemist's control.

The onyx ooze uses the gray ooze stat block with the following change: If the ooze takes fire damage it explodes and is destroyed, and all creatures within 10 feet of the ooze must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The explosion spreads around corners and ignites flammable objects within 10 feet of the ooze that aren't being worn or carried.

action.name: Choking Vial (1/Day)
entries: The alchemist hurls a glass vial filled with noxious gas at a point they can see within 20 feet of them, and a 20-foot-radius sphere of gas centered on that point emerges from the vial. The gas lingers in the air for 1 minute. Each creature that starts its turn in that cloud must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw against poison or spend their action retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed on this saving throw. Additionally, fire ignites the cloud, consuming it.
Creatures inside the cloud when it ignites take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) fire damage.

bonus.name: Acid Vial
entries: The alchemist hurls a glass vial of acid at a point they can see within 20 feet of them. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage.

trait.name: Mechanical Mastery
entries: The inventor automatically succeeds on Intelligence and Wisdom checks related to machines and other mechanical objects or contraptions.

trait.name: Signature Weapon
entries: The inventor wields one of the following signature weapons: blade-thrower, conductor, scalpel whip, or velocity hammer. The inventor only carries one of these weapons and uses their Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for the weapon's attack and damage rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The inventor makes two attacks with their signature weapon, unless their signature weapon is a velocity hammer.

action.name: Blade-Thrower
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage. If this damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, they are is cut in half and die, and the blade continues on its path in a straight line for the remainder of its normal range, attacking the next creature or object in the line.

action.name: Conductor
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) lightning damage.

action.name: Electrostatic Strike (1/Day; Conductor Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage plus 18 ({@damage 4d8}) lightning damage, and the target falls {@condition prone} and must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition paralyzed} until the end of their next turn.

Additionally, each creature touching the initial target, connected to the target by metal, or in the same body of water as the target is also hit with this attack. Once this action has been used the conductor can't deal lightning damage until it is available again.

action.name: Scalpel Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) poison damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 14}). At the start of the {@condition grappled} creature's turn, they must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. On subsequent turns, the inventor can use an action to make a contested Strength check against the {@condition grappled} creature, knocking the {@condition grappled} creature {@condition prone} on a success. While grappling a creature with this weapon, the inventor can't attack another target.

action.name: Velocity Hammer (1/Turn)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. Each successive hit with this attack deals an additional 3 ({@damage 1d6}) force damage. This extra damage resets if the inventor doesn't hit with this attack during their turn.

bonus.name: Gadget (1/Day)
entries: The inventor produces a Tiny or Small object that has the same properties as a common or uncommon wondrous item of the inventor's choice. This object falls apart and becomes useless after 1 hour. Choose one of the following or make your own:

items: An unfolding propeller with a crank that has the properties of a wind fan
A metal glove that fires energy from the fingertips that has the properties of a circlet of blasting
An earring that has the properties of a helm of comprehending languages
A bug pheromone perfume that has the properties of eyes of charming
A pair of spring-heeled boots that has the properties of boots of striding and springing
A face mask that has the properties of a necklace of adaptation

bonus.name: Signal Scrambler
entries: A Construct that the inventor can see within 60 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition stunned} until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Take Positions
entries: When the mercenary hits a creature with a weapon attack, any allied mercenaries within 30 feet of the target can move up to half their speed (no action required).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mercenary makes two Longsword attacks or Light Crossbow attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Light Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Squad Tactics
entries: When a creature the mercenary can see hits another creature with an attack, the mercenary can make a weapon attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Cloak and Dagger
entries: While the deadeye is hidden, they don't give away their location if they miss with a weapon attack.

trait.name: Deadly Aim
entries: Once per turn when the deadeye hits a creature with a weapon attack, they place a deadeye mark on the target after dealing damage. These marks vanish if the deadeye loses sight of the marked creature, if the marked creature dies or falls {@condition unconscious}, or if the deadeye attacks a new target.

When the deadeye hits a marked creature with a ranged weapon attack, the target takes an additional {@damage 1d8} damage for each of the deadeye's marks on the target. A creature can have up to three of a deadeye's marks.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Sight
entries: The deadeye has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The deadeye makes three Longbow or Shortsword attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Nimble Escape
entries: The deadeye takes the Disengage or Hide action.

trait.name: Coordinated Strike
entries: When the explorer hits a target with an attack, each creature that can see the target can use their reaction to make a weapon attack against the target.

trait.name: Refreshing Respite
entries: During a short rest, the explorer and friendly creatures that can see them can reroll any roll of 1 or 2 when they spend Hit Dice to regain hit points at the end of that rest.

trait.name: Seeker
entries: The explorer has advantage on Intelligence (Inves- tigation) and Wisdom (Perception) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors and hidden traps, and can always recall the path back to where they entered an underground area, such as a dungeon or cave.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The explorer makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range
100/400, one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Reinforced Net
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 5/15 ft., one Large or smaller creature. {@h}The target is {@condition restrained}. A creature can use its action to make a {@dc 15} Strength check to free itself or another creature in a net, ending the effect on a success. Dealing 15 slashing damage to the net (AC 15) frees the target without harming it and destroys the net.

trait.name: Calculated Defense
entries: While the detective is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, their AC includes their Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Evasion
entries: If the detective is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, the detective instead takes no damage if they succeed on the saving throw and only half damage if they fail, provided the detective isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The detective deals an extra 14 ({@damage 4d6}) damage when it hits a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the detective that isn't incapacitated and the detective doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Switched On
entries: The detective automatically detects illusions they can see and automatically succeeds on saving throws against them.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The detective makes three Sword Cane attacks. They can replace one of those attacks with a Hand Crossbow attack.

action.name: Sword Cane
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The detective takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

reaction.name: Uncanny Dodge
entries: The detective halves the damage that they take from an attack that hits them. The detective must be able to see the attacker.

trait.name: Charge
entries: The bodyguard can designate another creature to be their charge. When a creature within 5 feet of the bodyguard hits the charge with an attack, the bodyguard can make a melee attack against the creature (no action required). The bodyguard can only have one charge at a time.

trait.name: With Me, My Liege!
entries: If the bodyguard moves while their charge is within 5 feet of them, the charge can move up to their speed, remaining within 5 feet of the bodyguard (no action required for the charge).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The bodyguard makes three Longsword attacks or three Throwing Knife attacks. They can replace one Longsword attack with a Shield Bash attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Shield Bash
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Throwing Knife
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Run!
entries: The bodyguard shouts to their charge. If the charge is within 60 feet of the bodyguard and can hear them, the charge can immediately move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks (no action required for the charge).

reaction.name: Life and Limb
entries: When the bodyguard is within 5 feet of their charge and a creature the bodyguard can see attacks the charge, the bodyguard can swap positions with the charge and become the target of the attack instead.

trait.name: Counterattack
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the rōnin misses them with an attack, the rōnin can make one attack against the creature (no action required).

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the rōnin is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, their AC includes their Wisdom modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The rōnin makes four Daishō attacks.

action.name: Daishō
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Lethal Cut {@recharge 4}
entries: The rōnin leaps up to 15 feet in any direction then uses Multiattack.

action.name: Swift Strike (1/Day)
entries: The rōnin flies up to 30 feet in a straight line. During this movement, the rōnin can make up to six Daishō attacks against one or several targets within 5 feet of the line.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The rōnin adds 4 to their AC against one melee or ranged weapon attack that would hit them. To do so, the rōnin must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

trait.name: Ki Transfer (1/Turn)
entries: When the master hits a target that has more than 0 ki points with a melee weapon attack, the master can make a contested Wisdom check against the target. If the target loses the contest, they lose 1 ki point. If the target wins the contest, they gain 1 ki point.
If this trait reduces the target to 0 ki points, the target falls {@condition unconscious}.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: While the master is wearing no armor and wielding no shield, their AC includes their Wisdom modifier.

trait.name: Unarmored Movement
entries: While the master is wearing no armor, they can move along vertical surfaces and across liquids without falling during their movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The master makes six attacks.

action.name: Unarmed Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the master's next turn.

action.name: Wind God Strike (1/Day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage. If the target has 100 hit points or fewer, they must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or drop to 0 hit points.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

reaction.name: Deflect Missile
entries: In response to being hit by a ranged weapon attack, the master deflects the missile. The damage they take from the attack is reduced by {@dice 1d10 + 4}. If the damage is reduced to 0, the master catches the missile if it's small enough to hold in one hand and the master has a hand free. If the master catches a missile in this way, they can immediately make a ranged attack ({@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 feet) with the weapon or piece of ammunition they just caught, which deals 8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) damage of the weapon's type on hit.

trait.name: Bloody Zeal
entries: While the guard has half their hit points or fewer, their weapon attacks score a critical hit on a roll of

trait.name: Unquenchable
entries: When the guard is reduced to 0 hit points, they drop to 1 hit point instead and become immune to all damage until the end of their next turn. If the guard still has 1 hit point at the end of their next turn, they are reduced to 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The guard makes three Greataxe attacks.

action.name: Greataxe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d12 + 4}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Battle Hardened
entries: When a creature within 15 feet of the guard hits another creature with an attack, the guard can move up to half their speed toward the attacker. If the guard ends the movement within 5 feet of the attacker, they can make a weapon attack against the attacker.

monster.name: Hierophant

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hierophant casts up to three spells.

action.name: Flame Blade (2nd-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 3d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Call Lightning (3rd-Level Spell)
entries: A magical bolt of lightning flashes down from the sky to a point the hierophant can see within 120 feet of them. Each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 16 ({@damage 3d10}) lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Tree Stride (3/Day; 5th-Level Spell)
entries: The hierophant enters a tree using 5 feet of movement, and moves from inside it to inside another tree of the same kind within 500 feet, appearing within 5 feet of the destination tree. Both trees must be living and at least the same size as the hierophant.

action.name: Heal (1/Day; 6th-Level Spell)
entries: A creature the hierophant can see within 60 feet regains 70 hit points. This spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on Constructs or Undead.

bonus.name: Control Plants
entries: Thick vines grow from beneath one creature or object the hierophant can see within 60 feet, attempting to grab and restrain the target. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). If the target is already {@condition grappled} by this action, then they also become {@condition restrained} while {@condition grappled}. A mass of vines that only has a creature {@condition grappled} has AC 11 and 10 hit points. A mass of vines that has a creature {@condition restrained} has AC 11 and 30 hit points.

reaction.name: Féth Fíada (1/Day)
entries: When the hierophant takes damage, they can create a 10-foot-high, 60-foot-radius cylinder of mist centered on themself, and the hierophant turns {@condition invisible} for 10 minutes or until they attack or cast a spell.

When the mist first appears, the hierophant and up to five creatures they choose can see through the mist. For all other creatures, the mist is filled with strange and haunting illusions; trees appear to move on their own, cold whispers linger in the air, and all sense of direction is lost.

Each affected creature within the mist is {@condition blinded}, has their speed halved, and can't hear the voices of any other creatures within the mist but can still hear their own. The mist dissipates after 10 minutes, when the hierophant is {@condition incapacitated}, or when a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

legendaryHeader: The hierophant has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Wild Compulsion
entries: The hierophant chooses up to five creatures that they can see within 60 feet of them.
Those creatures can move up to their speed (no action required).

legendary.name: Action 2: Discordant Drone
entries: Each enemy of the hierophant's choice within 60 feet of them that can hear the hierophant has any spell of 3rd level or lower that is affecting them end, and any enemy spellcasters of the hierophant's choice within 60 feet of them that are {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell and can hear the hierophant must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or lose {@status concentration}.

legendary.name: Action 3: Blood Sacrifice
entries: The hierophant targets up to five allied creatures with fewer hit points than their hit point maximum that the hierophant can see within 60 feet of them. Each target is reduced to 0 hit points, and up to five other creatures of the hierophant's choice within 60 feet of them gain temporary hit points equal to the hit points lost by the initial targets divided by the number of targets (rounded down). While a creature has temporary hit points granted by this villain action, they make attack rolls with advantage and have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

monster.name: Auto-Sentinel

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks that aren't adamantine

languages: understands the languages of their creator but can't speak

trait.name: Charge
entries: The sentinel can designate another creature to be their charge. When a creature within 5 feet of the sentinel hits the sentinel's charge with an attack and the sentinel isn't {@condition incapacitated}, the sentinel can immediately make a melee attack against the creature (no action required).
The sentinel can only have one charge at a time.

trait.name: Siege Engine
entries: The sentinel deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The sentinel makes three Pneumatic Fist attacks. They can replace one attack with a Grapple- Hand attack or a use of Reel.

action.name: Pneumatic Fist
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Grapple-Hand
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 50 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and the target is {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 17}). Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength ability checks and saving throws, and the sentinel can't use the same hand to attack or grapple another target. The sentinel has two hands.

action.name: Reel
entries: The sentinel pulls each creature they are grappling 25 feet straight toward themself.

action.name: Beeline
entries: The sentinel moves up to their speed in a straight line toward their charge. During this move, the sentinel ignores difficult terrain, can move through hostile creatures' spaces regardless of their size, and smashes through minor nonmagical obstacles in their path such as doors, windows, or walls less than 1 foot thick. Each {@condition prone} creature whose space the sentinel moves through takes 44 ({@damage 8d10}) bludgeoning damage. Each creature who isn't {@condition prone} whose space the sentinel moves through must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature takes 16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 5 feet away into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice, or knocked {@condition prone} in their current space if there is no unoccupied space within range. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed or knocked {@condition prone}.

reaction.name: Life and Limb
entries: When the sentinel is within 5 feet of their charge and a creature the sentinel can see attacks the charge, the sentinel can swap positions with the charge and become the target of the attack instead.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest casts one of the following spells, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The priest makes three Claw attacks, and they make a Fire Bolt attack or use Spellcasting.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) slashing damage plus 9 ({@damage 2d8}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Bolt (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage. A flammable object hit by this spell ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The priest exhales fire in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 42 ({@damage 12d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Additionally, a creature loses any resistance or immunity to fire damage for 1 minute if they take or would have taken damage from this action.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the slayer is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

trait.name: Dragonsbane
entries: When one of the slayer's actions or abilities refers to creatures with the Dragon type, it includes creatures that have draconic ancestry, such as dragon priests, dragonborn, Draconic Bloodline sorcerers, and kobolds.

trait.name: Underdog
entries: The slayer can grapple a creature of any size and has advantage on Strength (Athletics) or Dexterity (Acrobatics) checks made to grapple or climb onto a creature that is of a size larger than themself. While grappling or clinging to a creature that is of a size larger than themself, the slayer makes attack rolls against that creature with advantage. If the slayer grapples a creature that is at least two sizes larger than the slayer, the slayer's speed becomes 0 instead of the target's speed, and if a creature {@condition grappled} in this way by the slayer moves, the slayer moves with them, requiring none of the slayer's movement.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The slayer makes three attacks.

action.name: Battleaxe of Dragon Slaying
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit (or +10 against a Dragon), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage, or 9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage if used with two hands. If the target is a Dragon, they take an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Javelin of Dragon Slaying
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit (or +10 against a Dragon), range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a Dragon, they must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking an additional 33 ({@damage 6d10}) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.
The slayer carries four javelins. Once a javelin of dragon slaying deals its extra damage to a Dragon, it becomes a nonmagical javelin.

action.name: Wings of Flying (2/Day)
entries: The slayer turns their cloak into a pair of wings, gaining a flying speed of 60 feet for 1 hour.

reaction.name: Sudden Strike (3/Day)
entries: When a creature the slayer can see moves within 30 feet of the slayer, the slayer can make a weapon attack against that creature. If the attack hits, the target's speed is halved until the end of the current turn

trait.name: Bodymind Trance
entries: The gish has advantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain {@status concentration} on a spell, and is immune to any effect that allows other creatures to sense their emotions or read their thoughts, as well as any divination spell that they refuse. If the gish takes psychic damage, this trait doesn't function until the start of the gish's next turn.

trait.name: Swordkeeper
entries: If the gish is wielding a sword, their weapon attacks are magical and have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included in the attack).

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gish makes two Longsword or Eldritch Blast attacks, and they use Signcasting.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast (Cantrip)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 8} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d10}) force damage.

action.name: Signcasting
entries: The gish casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks):
At will: burning hands, detect magic, light, mage hand
3/day each: {@spell dispel magic}, fireball, vampiric touch
1/day each: cone of cold, fire shield, haste, wall of force

bonus.name: Witch Step
entries: The gish magically teleports, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, up to 45 feet to an unoccupied space they can see.

reaction.name: Shield (3/Day; 1st-Level Spell)
entries: When the gish is hit by an attack or targeted by a {@spell magic missile} spell, an {@condition invisible} barrier of magical force appears and protects them.
Until the start of their next turn, the gish has a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and the gish takes no damage from magic missile.

trait.name: Action Surge (3/Day)
entries: Once on their turn, the hero can take one additional action.

trait.name: Feral Instinct
entries: The hero has advantage on initiative rolls and can't be surprised.

trait.name: Impossible Arm
entries: The hero can wield two-handed weapons with one hand. If a weapon has the versatile property, the hero always uses the two-handed damage die.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The hero's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Siege Monster
entries: The hero deals double damage to objects and structures.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The hero makes two Maul attacks and uses Overwhelming Attack.

action.name: Maul
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Overwhelming Attack
entries: The hero makes a Maul attack that targets any number of creatures within 5 feet of the hero and uses the same attack roll for each target. The hero deals an extra 21 ({@damage 6d6}) bludgeoning damage to each target they hit with this attack.

action.name: Supersonic Yawp
entries: The hero unleashes an ear-splitting battle cry in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area that can hear the hero must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) thunder damage and is {@condition deafened} for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition deafened}. A creature made of inorganic material such as stone, crystal, or metal has disadvantage on this saving throw.

action.name: Seismic Wave {@recharge 5}
entries: The hero stomps their foot with the force of a falling meteorite. Each creature standing on the ground within 30 feet of the hero takes 26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and must succeed on a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

bonus.name: Barbaric Leap
entries: The hero jumps up to 20 feet in any direction and can land in another creature's space. If they land in another creature's space, that creature takes 12 ({@damage 2d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and is pushed 5 feet away from the hero into an unoccupied space of the creature's choice, or knocked {@condition prone} in their current space if there is no unoccupied space within range. Additionally, the hero has advantage on attacks made against creatures within 5 feet of the space they landed in until the end of their turn.

bonus.name: Hidden Strength (1/Day)
entries: The hero regains 57 ({@dice 6d8 + 30}) hit points.

reaction.name: Think Again
entries: When the hero is hit with a weapon attack that isn't a critical hit by a creature they can see within 120 feet of them, the hero can catch the weapon with their bare hands, causing the attack to miss instead. If the weapon is nonmagical, it is destroyed.

trait.name: Avoidance
entries: If the polymath is subjected to an effect that allows them to make a saving throw to take only half damage, they instead take no damage if they succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if they fail.

trait.name: Calculated Defense
entries: While the polymath is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, their AC includes their Intelligence modifier.

trait.name: Genius Intellect
entries: The polymath always knows the exact time and their exact location while on their native plane, can recall any piece of information they have learned, and can instantly complete mathematical calculations in their head.

trait.name: Practiced Hand
entries: The polymath can use their Intelligence modifier, instead of Strength or Dexterity, for weapon attack and damage rolls.

trait.name: Sneak Attack (1/Turn)
entries: The polymath deals an extra 17 ({@damage 5d6}) damage when they hit a target with a weapon attack and has advantage on the attack roll, or when the target is within 5 feet of an ally of the polymath that isn't incapacitated and the polymath doesn't have disadvantage on the attack roll.

trait.name: Switched On
entries: The polymath always knows when they see an illusion, but can't see through the image without interacting with the illusion.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The polymath makes three weapon attacks.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) piercing damage plus 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Stunning Strike (3/Day)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the polymath's next turn.

action.name: Hand Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 12} to hit, range 30/120 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d6 + 6}) piercing damage plus 28 ({@damage 8d6}) poison damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or become {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Spell Scrolls
entries: The polymath casts one of the following spells from a spell scroll (spell save {@dc 18}). After casting the spell, the scroll is destroyed and the polymath can't cast it again.
8th level: {@spell antimagic field}, clone, earthquake, glibness, mind blank
9th level: gate

bonus.name: Cunning Action
entries: The polymath takes the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

bonus.name: Stillness of Mind
entries: The polymath ends one effect that is causing them to be {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

bonus.name: Lair Actions
entries: On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the polymath can take a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the polymath can't use the same effect two rounds in a row.

• The polymath activates powerful magnets in the lair's roof, attracting metal equipment and objects in a 10-foot radius cylinder, extending from the floor to the ceiling, centered on a point the polymath can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, any metal weapon or object held by the target is wrenched out of their grasp and attaches to the ceiling.

Additionally, if the target is wearing medium or heavy armor made of metal, they fall upward, taking fall damage as they would during a downward fall when they strike the ceiling, and become {@condition restrained}. Affected objects and creatures fall back down at the end of initiative count 20 on the next round.

• Arrows fire from hidden traps in the walls, targeting three creatures of the polymath's choice within 60 feet of them. Each target must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, a target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of their next turn. On a successful save, the target takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition poisoned}.
• A 5-foot-wide, 10-foot-tall hidden door opens in one of the lair's walls at a point of the polymath's choice.

If the polymath is within 5 feet of the opening when it appears, they can move up to their speed without provoking opportunity attacks through the opening as part of this lair action, and the door closes behind them. If the polymath isn't within 5 feet of the opening when it appears, {@dice 1d4 + 1} mercenaries2 or veterans loyal to the polymath enter the room, acting on initiative count 20 each round after the polymath takes a lair action.

reaction.name: Repartee
entries: The polymath adds +4 to their AC against one weapon attack that would hit them. To do so, the polymath must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon. The polymath can then make a weapon attack against the attacker.

trait.name: Celestial Resurrection
entries: A destroyed saint gains a new body in {@dice 1d10} days, regaining all their hit points and becoming active again. The new body appears on consecrated ground that is sacred to the saint's deity, such as an altar, shrine, or temple.

trait.name: Cone of Awe
entries: The saint's gaze creates a 150-foot cone that overwhelms mortals with a sense of shock, terror, and wonder. At the start of each of their turns, the saint decides which way the cone faces and if the cone is active. Any creature who starts their turn in the cone must succeed on a {@dc 20} Charisma saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) radiant damage and become {@condition frightened} of the saint for 1 minute. A {@condition frightened} creature can repeat this saving throw at the start of each of their turns, ending the effect on themself on a success.

trait.name: Divine Awareness
entries: The saint knows if they hear a lie.

trait.name: Eternal Resistance
entries: The saint has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.
Additionally, if the saint fails a saving throw, they can choose to destroy one of their hallowed weapons, if available, and succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The saint makes two attacks and uses Flaming Rain.

action.name: Inflict Wounds (5th-Level Spell)
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 15} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}38 ({@damage 7d10}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Flaming Rain
entries: Bolts of flame-like radiance descend on up to three creatures that the saint can see within 120 feet of the saint. A target must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) radiant damage.
A target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

action.name: Plane Shift (7th-Level Spell)
entries: The saint casts the {@spell plane shift} spell, using Charisma as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 23}, {@hit 15} to hit).

action.name: Heal (3/Day; 8th-Level Spell)
entries: One creature that the saint can see within 60 feet of the saint regains 90 hit points. This spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on Constructs or Undead.

bonus.name: Hallowed Weapons (1/Day)
entries: The saint creates three floating, spectral weapons at three different points within 60 feet of them. The weapons can take whatever forms the saint chooses. These weapons last for 1 minute. The weapons have a reach of 5 feet and can each make one opportunity attack a round without using the saint's reaction.

When the weapons are first created, they can each make a melee spell attack (+15 bonus to hit) against one creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes 21 ({@damage 3d8 + 8}) force damage.
As a bonus action on later turns, the saint can move each weapon up to 30 feet and make one attack with it against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon.

Villain Actions The saint has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

bonus.name: 1. Fiery Translocation
entries: The saint magically teleports, along with any equipment they are wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space they can see. Each creature within 15 feet of the space the saint entered must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 ({@damage 8d6}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: 2. Shackles of Judgment
entries: Glowing chains appear from beneath up to five creatures the saint can see within 60 feet of them. Each creature must succeed on a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw or become {@condition grappled} by the chains (escape {@dc 20}). Until this grapple ends, a target is {@condition restrained} and has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The chains have AC 20, 10 hit points, and immunity to poison and psychic damage.

bonus.name: 3. Word of Unmaking
entries: A beam of bright light erupts from the mouth of the saint toward one target they can see within 60 feet of them. The target can be a creature, object, or creation of magical force, such as the wall created by wall of force.

A creature targeted by this action must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the target takes 106 ({@damage 19d6 + 40}) force damage and becomes {@condition frightened} of the saint and {@condition deafened} until they finish a short or long rest. The target is disintegrated if this damage leaves them with 0 hit points.

A disintegrated creature and everything it is wearing and carrying, except magic items, are reduced to a pile of fine gray dust. The creature can be restored to life only by means of a true resurrection or a {@spell wish} spell.
This ability automatically disintegrates a Huge or smaller nonmagical object or a creation of magical force.
If the target is a Gargantuan object or creation of force, this spell disintegrates a 20-foot-cube portion of it. A magic item is unaffected by this spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Librarian casts one of the following spells, requiring no material or verbal components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 22}):

trait.name: Celestial Weapons
entries: The Librarian's weapon attacks are magical. When the Librarian hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra {@damage 3d8} radiant damage (included in the attack).

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Librarian fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Librarian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Protective Prison
entries: The Librarian can't leave the Vault by any means unless the gods that created the Vault end her imprisonment.

trait.name: Regeneration
entries: The Librarian regains 20 hit points at the start of her turn if she has at least 1 hit point and is in the Vault.

trait.name: Renewed
entries: If the Librarian is destroyed, the Vault's magical operations cease for {@dice 1d10} days. At the end of this time, the Librarian reforms in the Vault, regaining all her hit points and becoming active again.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Librarian makes two Tome Smack attacks and one Tsk, Tsk, Tsk attack.

action.name: Tome Smack
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage.

action.name: Tsk, Tsk, Tsk
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 14} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}34 ({@damage 4d12 + 8}) psychic damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw or be unable to make ranged attacks or cast spells other than cantrips for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of their turns, ending the effect on themself on a success.

action.name: This Needs Work {@recharge 5}
entries: The Librarian pulls a lifebook and a feather quill from the air, then rewrites the fates of those who dare attack her. All creatures of the Librarian's choice within 60 feet of her must make a {@dc 22} Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 32 ({@damage 5d12}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} until the start of the Librarian's next turn. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn't {@condition stunned}.

bonus.name: Quick Edits
entries: The Librarian pulls a pencil from her hair and writes in the air, summoning a distracting, illusory object within 5 feet of a creature she can see within 60 feet of her. The target has disadvantage on the next attack roll they make before the start of the Librarian's next turn, whereupon the object disappears.

reaction.name: Choose My Own Path
entries: When the Librarian is targeted by an attack, she can step into one lifebook within 5 feet of her and emerge from a second lifebook within 120 feet of her, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second lifebook, potentially causing the attack to miss if the Librarian is out of range of the attack.

legendary.name: Cloud of Pages
entries: The Librarian calls books from the shelves and stacks around her, filling the air with whirling tomes and pages in a 5-foot-radius, 20-foot- high column centered on a point within 120 feet of her. A creature except for the Librarian takes 15 ({@damage 6d4}) slashing damage when they enter that area for the first time on a turn or start their turn there. The books fall to the ground at the start of the Librarian's next turn.

legendary.name: Pen Is Mightier
entries: The Librarian makes a Tome Smack attack.

legendary.name: Shhh!
entries: The Librarian casts the {@spell silence} spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: Garin can cast the following spells, using Wisdom as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 16}) and requiring no material components:

trait.name: Prophet Motive
entries: When casting a spell requiring {@status concentration} on another creature, Garin can replicate the effect on himself.
If the spell ends, the effect ends on him as well.

action.name: Dragonfang Kris
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) radiant damage.

action.name: Sacred Flame (Cantrip)
entries: Flame-like radiance descends on one creature Garin can see within 60 feet of him. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 13 ({@damage 3d8}) radiant damage, gaining no benefit from cover.

action.name: Haste (3/Day; 3rd-Level Spell; Concentration)
entries: Garin chooses a willing creature he can see within 30 feet of him. Until the spell ends, his and the target's speeds are both doubled, they both gain a +2 bonus to AC, they have advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and they each gain an additional action on each of their turns. That action can be used only to take the Attack (one weapon attack only), Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object action. When the spell ends, the target (but not Garin) can't move or take actions until after their next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over them.

bonus.name: Fiscal Cyclone
entries: Garin creates a swirling mass of spectral coins in a 5-foot cube centered on a point within 60 feet of him. A creature who starts their turn in the area of one or more of these cyclones, or who enters one for the first time on a turn, takes 14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) force damage. The effect lasts until Garin dismisses it (no action required) or falls {@condition unconscious}.

reaction.name: Divine Kleptocracy (1/Day)
entries: When another creature Garin can see within 30 feet of him is targeted by a spell that requires {@status concentration}, Garin can duplicate the spell's effect on himself (requiring no {@status concentration}). If the spell ends for the other creature, the effect ends for him at the end of his next turn.

reaction.name: Object of Desire (2/Day)
entries: When another creature within 30 feet of Garin targets him with an attack or spell, he can hold up his holy symbol and make it appear as the object the attacker desires most. The attacker must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of Garin's next turn.

monster.name: Sym (The Mischanging Changeling)

trait.name: Pyrite Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If Sym fails a saving throw, they can choose to succeed instead. They revert to their true form (if they are not in it already) and lose access to their Prophetic Metamorph bonus action until the start of their next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Sym makes two Gold Claw attacks.

action.name: Gold Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) slashing damage plus 3 ({@damage 1d6}) fire damage.

action.name: Read Thoughts
entries: Sym magically reads the surface thoughts of one creature within 60 feet of them. The effect can penetrate barriers, but 3 feet of wood or dirt, 2 feet of stone, 2 inches of metal, or a thin sheet of lead blocks it. While the target is in range, Sym can continue reading their thoughts, as long as their {@status concentration} isn't broken (as if {@status concentration||concentrating} on a spell). While reading the target's mind, Sym has advantage on Wisdom (Insight) and Charisma (Deception, Intimidation, and Persuasion) checks against the target.

bonus.name: Prophetic Metamorph
entries: Sym magically polymorphs into a Humanoid or Beast with a challenge rating of 12 or less, or back into their true form. Any equipment they're wearing or carrying is absorbed or borne by the new form (Sym's choice). In a new form, Sym retains their hit points, Hit Dice, ability to speak, proficiencies, immunities, Read Thoughts action, Prophetic Metamorph bonus action, villain actions, and Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Their statistics are otherwise replaced by those of the new form, including the form's spell attack bonus and saving throw DCs. They revert to their true form if they die.

legendaryHeader: Sym has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

legendary.name: Villain Action 1:
entries: Face-Off. Sym swaps places with one creature they can see within 60 feet of them and simultaneously takes on the target's appearance, without changing their statistics, until they use their Prophetic Metamorph bonus action. A creature with a passive Perception score of 17 or higher who can see Sym and the target automatically notices the swap; otherwise, a creature who interacts with Sym or the target can use a bonus action to make a {@dc 17} Wisdom (Insight or Perception) check, detecting the ruse on a success.

legendary.name: Villain Action 2:
entries: Form & Function. Sym rapidly shifts between their favored forms to create a devastating (and visually exquisite) combination blow. Sym chooses a creature within 30 feet of them, shifts into the minotaur Thollos, and moves within reach to make a Gore attack against the target that tosses the target 5 feet into the air.

legendary.name: Gore
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

Sym then shifts into the goblin Plix and uses their maul to make a Slam attack against the target, leaping up to hit the target midair if they were tossed by the Gore attack. If the target is {@condition prone}, the Slam attack is automatically a critical hit.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.
Sym then uses their Prophetic Metamorph bonus action.

legendary.name: Villain Action 3:
entries: Divine Molt. Sym regains 60 hit points and transforms into a young gold dragon, as though they had used their Prophetic Metamorph bonus action. This effect lasts for 1 minute or until they use Prophetic Metamorph again.

monster.name: Hecta Glintstone (Invisible Hand of Capitalism)

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Utility)
headerEntries: At will: detect magic, druidcraft, guidance, mending, produce flame

trait.name: Caustic Humors
entries: A creature who touches Hecta or hits her with a melee attack while within 5 feet of her takes 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage.

trait.name: Rock Solid (3/Day)
entries: If Hecta fails a saving throw, she can choose to succeed instead. Her Caustic Humors trait ceases to function until the start of her next turn.

trait.name: Thundering Aegis
entries: Diamonds embedded in Hecta's skin pulse with thunderous energy, surrounding her in an aura that repels projectiles. Ranged attacks made against Hecta have disadvantage, and being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on Hecta's ranged attack rolls.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: Hecta makes two Oligarch attacks, or one Oligarch attack and one Pineal Precious attack.

action.name: Oligarch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) bludgeoning damage plus 6 ({@damage 1d12}) acid damage, and the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or fall {@condition prone}. If the target fails this save during their turn, their turn ends.

action.name: Pineal Precious (4/Day)
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 10} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 4d12 + 5}) fire damage.

action.name: Thunderwave (3/Day; 5th-Level Spell)
entries: A wave of thunderous force bursts out from Hecta. Each creature in a 15-foot cube originating from Hecta must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from her. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

bonus.name: Worm Crusher
entries: Immediately after Hecta knocks a creature {@condition prone}, she can make one Oligarch attack against that creature.

reaction.name: Redirect
entries: When Hecta takes damage while connected to conduceres (from her Subordinate Synergy villain action), she can split that damage between one or more connected conduceres, dealing a total amount of damage equal to the damage she would have taken. Each conducere who takes damage in this way can immediately use their Energy Conductor without using a reaction.

legendaryHeader: Hecta has three villain actions. She can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. She takes villain action 1 during the first round of combat, villain action 2 during the second round, and villain action 3 during the third round.

legendary.name: Villain Action 1:
entries: Subordinate Synergy. Hecta establishes connections with each conducere within 30 feet of her, creating 5-foot-wide lines of harmless crackling energy that connect her to them. The lines remain and move with her and the conduceres until Hecta uses her Elemental Liquidation villain action. The connection with a conducere ends if that conducere dies or ends their turn more than 30 feet from Hecta.

legendary.name: Villain Action 2:
entries: Arc Reaction. The lines of energy connecting Hecta and the conduceres connected to her flare with raw primordial power. Additional energy lines form between connected conduceres within 30 feet of each other. Any creature (except a connected conducere) who starts their turn in a space these lines pass through, or enters such a space for the first time on a turn, takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) fire damage.

legendary.name: Villain Action 3:
entries: Elemental Liquidation. Hecta makes four Pineal Precious attacks, originating from conduceres of her choice. These attacks do not count against her daily uses of this attack. If there are no conduceres within 120 feet of her, Hecta can cause the gem in her forehead to explode with fiery energy and make four Pineal Precious attacks; she then takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) force damage and can't make a Pineal Precious attack until the next day. After Hecta uses this villain action, the lines created by her Subordinate Synergy villain action disappear.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The coldshell can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Bioluminescent
entries: The coldshell's flesh sheds dim light in a 30-foot radius.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the coldshell has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Weak Spot
entries: The coldshell has a weak point in their armor that can only be targeted up close. Creatures who are within 5 feet of the coldshell roll to hit against the coldshell's {@condition prone} AC.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The coldshell makes three attacks using Crushing Embrace, Tentacles, or a combination of them. They can replace one attack with a use of Devour.

action.name: Crushing Embrace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 4d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, they are {@condition grappled} (escape {@dc 15}). The coldshell can grapple only one creature at a time.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) bludgeoning damage, and if the target is a Large or smaller creature, they are pulled up to 15 feet toward the coldshell.

action.name: Devour
entries: The creature {@condition grappled} by Crushing Embrace takes 27 ({@damage 4d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Freezing Spit
entries: The coldshell targets one creature they can see within 60 feet of them. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage and have

monster.name: Dreameater
languages: all but speaks only in unintelligible whispering

trait.name: Mindthirst
entries: If the dreameater knows the name and appearance of another creature, they are aware of when that creature takes a short or long rest and the direction to that creature while they are resting.

trait.name: Nightmarish Nature
entries: The dreameater doesn't require air, food, or sleep.

trait.name: Shadowshroud
entries: Magical darkness emanates from the dreameater, filling a 20-foot-radius sphere that moves with them and disappears when they die. The darkness spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. If any of the dreameater's darkness overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 2nd level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled. When the dreameater takes damage, the darkness created by this trait becomes an area of dim light until the end of their next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The dreameater can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Supernatural Resistance
entries: The dreameater has advantage on saving throws against spells, powers, and other supernatural effects. (Supernatural = magic or psionic)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The dreameater makes two Strangle attacks and one Proboscis attack.

action.name: Strangle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage plus 5 ({@damage 1d10}) psychic damage.

action.name: Proboscis
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 20 ft., one target. {@h}1 piercing damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The dreameater regains a number of hit points equal to half the amount of psychic damage dealt.

bonus.name: Disquieting Murmurs
entries: Each creature within 60 feet of the dreameater must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage. If this deals damage to a creature {@status concentration||concentrating} on a power, spell, or other feature, that creature has disadvantage on the saving throw they make to maintain their {@status concentration}.

legendaryHeader: The dreameater has three villain actions. They can take each action once during an encounter after an enemy creature's turn. They can take these actions in any order but can only use one per round.

legendary.name: Action 1: Always Hungry
entries: The dreameater's proboscis supernaturally extends to reach out of the dark. One Large or smaller creature the dreameater can see within 60 feet of them must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be pulled up to 60 feet directly toward the dreameater.

legendary.name: Action 2: Thimblerig
entries: The dreameater teleports to an unoccupied space they can see within 40 feet of them and takes the Hide action. Immediately after, two 20-foot-radius spheres of magical darkness appear, centered on two different points the dreameater can see within 40 feet of them. This darkness lasts 10 minutes and spreads around corners. A creature with darkvision can't see through this darkness, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. If any of this darkness's area overlaps with an area of light created by a spell of 4th level or lower, the spell that created the light is dispelled.

legendary.name: Action 3: Gathering Gloom
entries: Each area of magical darkness within 300 feet of the dreameater increases in size by 10 feet.

Each creature in an area of magical darkness after it increases must make a {@dc 16} Charisma saving throw, taking 36 ({@damage 8d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one, as the shadows gnaw at creatures caught within.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The gravedigger doesn't require air or sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The gravedigger makes three attacks using Hook and Chain, Keratin Sword, or a combination of them. They can replace one attack with a use of Command Earth.

action.name: Hook and Chain
